intro: Platostoma laxiflorum, commonly known as the looseflower rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
